title: Are You Ready to Make the Transition to MACRA?
description: While 2017 is considered a "transition year" for the Medicare Access and CHIP Reauthorization Act, better known as MACRA, it is certainly no time to coast. Over time, this physician-focused quality payment program will either reward, penalize or provide zero adjustment to a clinician's reimbursement, depending on their performance.
body: While 2017 is considered a "transition year" for the Medicare Access and CHIP Reauthorization Act, better known as MACRA, it is certainly no time to coast. Over time, this physician-focused quality payment program will either reward, penalize or provide zero adjustment to a clinician's reimbursement, depending on their performance.

title: Bridging the Gap Between Big Data Science, Health IT Usability
description: The health IT landscape often seems starkly divided between two opposing camps: those who design elegant algorithms and regimented workflows in the idealized sterility of the R&D department, and those whose frenzied, frustrating daily experience in the hospital, office, or clinic have taught them that there is no such thing as an out-of-the-box solution to any of their big data needs.

title: OIG Identifies Vulnerabilities in CMS' Deployment of MACRA
description: The Department of Health and Human Service's (HHS) Office of the Inspector General (OIG) has identified two vulnerabilities related to MACRA that the department says the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services' (CMS) must address. MACRA, or the Medicare Access and CHIP Reauthorization Act of 2015, enacted clinician payment reforms designed to put increased focus on the quality and value of care.

title: MACRA patient engagement cheat sheet No. 4: Patient engagement strategies for bundled payments
description: Bundled payment programs are a type of value-based care program that have become much more significant with the emergence of the Medicare Access and CHIP Reauthorization Act. For the first time, a bundled payment program, the Comprehensive Care for Joint Replacement initiative, is mandatory for some providers rather than just optional. CMS has signaled that this is the beginning, not the end, of mandatory payment bundling for specific episodes of care. Also, on the private payer front, payment bundling is rapidly gaining interest. Boeing and United Airlines have negotiated specific bundled payment programs with certain providers, and other private payers and large employer groups are doing the same.
body: Bundled payment programs are a type of value-based care program that have become much more significant with the emergence of the Medicare Access and CHIP Reauthorization Act. For the first time, a bundled payment program, the Comprehensive Care for Joint Replacement initiative, is mandatory for some providers rather than just optional. CMS has signaled that this is the beginning, not the end, of mandatory payment bundling for specific episodes of care. Also, on the private payer front, payment bundling is rapidly gaining interest. Boeing and United Airlines have negotiated specific bundled payment programs with certain providers, and other private payers and large employer groups are doing the same.
context: Read this article from Becker's Hospital review on patient engagement strategies for bundled payments, value-based care and MACRA.

title: 3 ways Trump admin could impact health IT regs
description: Providers might not always like it, but the federal government has taken an active role in advancing health information technology , from improving interoperability to encouraging e-prescribing to doling out incentives for meaningful use of electronic health records—or penalties for those who fail to do so. But when Donald Trump takes office, his goals will likely be in conflict with the path the current administration has been on for the past 8 years.
body: Providers might not always like it, but the federal government has taken an active role in advancing health information technology, from improving interoperability to encouraging e-prescribing to doling out incentives for meaningful use of electronic health records—or penalties for those who fail to do so. But when Donald Trump takes office, his goals will likely be in conflict with the path the current administration has been on for the past 8 years.

title: Repeal and replace, part deux: A return to the dark days of unaccountable care?
description: The ACA forced the kind of accountability that had been mostly talk, with little action, for the better part of two decades. It set standards for the development of quality measures and, through more than a dozen programs, tied Medicare payments to performance on those measures and others related to readmission rates, safety standards, and patient satisfaction. What happens if it goes?
body: The ACA forced the kind of accountability that had been mostly talk, with little action, for the better part of two decades. It set standards for the development of quality measures and, through more than a dozen programs, tied Medicare payments to performance on those measures and others related to readmission rates, safety standards, and patient satisfaction. What happens if it goes?

We offer a variety of learning tools including simulators, quizzes, interactive games, activities and tools, supporting both elearning and mobile learning (mlearning).

title: Precyse University DNA recognized during the Keynote Session at HealthStream Summit!
description: Don't miss  Tom Ormondroyd, President of Education and Analytics at nThrive speak on Friday, October 28th, from 1:30PM – 3:30PM on “Building a Skilled Health Care Workforce Organically.” Tom will also be conducting a 15 minute product demonstration on the Learning Stage during the conference and will be recognized during the Keynote Session!
body: Don't miss Tom Ormondroyd, President of Education and Analytics at nThrive speak on Friday, October 28th, from 1:30PM – 3:30PM on “Building a Skilled Health Care Workforce Organically.” Tom will also be conducting a 15 minute product demonstration on the Learning Stage during the conference and will be recognized during the Keynote Session!

title: nThrive Wins Gold for Best Visual Identity in Healthcare and Pharmaceutical at Transform Awards!
description: nThrive wins its third award at the Transform Awards! Transform Magazine honors and rewards the most innovative, creative and successful brand work across the world. Each of the prestigious award programs focus on specific aspects of the branding process and provides a platform from which to benchmark and showcase excellence.

Each of the prestigious award programs focus on specific aspects of the branding process and provides a platform from which to benchmark and showcase excellence.

Addressing HIPAA as an Obstacle to Health Data Exchange
description: ONC and other federal agencies are working to advance health data exchange by improving provider education and Medicare reimbursement requirements.
body: ONC and other federal agencies are working to advance health data exchange by improving provider education and Medicare reimbursement requirements.

title: Why Accountable Care Organizations Should Adopt Bundled Payment
description: The next step CMS may need to consider is to implement bundled payment models among more experienced Pioneer accountable care organizations.
body: The next step CMS may need to consider is to implement bundled payment models among more experienced Pioneer accountable care organizations.

source.network: The Portland Press Herald / Maine Sunday Telegram

title: Converting paper records to digital files a slow, difficult process - The Portland Press Herald / Maine Sunday Telegram
description: The absence of shared definitions and translations have stalled benefits of electronic medical records.
body: The absence of shared definitions and translations have stalled benefits of electronic medical records.

title: Health IT grows in importance in final MACRA rule
description: Vendors have a significant opportunity to help clinicians improve the flow of electronic health information and increase the quality of care they provide, says CMS’ Andy Slavitt.
body: Vendors have a significant opportunity to help clinicians improve the flow of electronic health information and increase the quality of care they provide, says CMS’ Andy Slavitt.

title: ONC Rule Allows for More Transparency, Oversight of IT Products
description: The rule finalized by The Office of the National Coordinator for Health IT focuses on three key areas: Review, Oversight and Transparency.
body: The rule finalized by The Office of the National Coordinator for Health IT focuses on three key areas: Review, Oversight and Transparency.

How Data Encryption Benefits Data Security
description: Hospitals and providers should consider healthcare data encryption options as a viable way to work toward data breach prevention.
body: Hospitals and providers should consider healthcare data encryption options as a viable way to work toward data breach prevention.

title: Health IT takes large role on the frontlines of response to Zika
description: ONC is closely supporting CDC’s Emergency Operations Center in combating the growing Zika outbreak.
body: ONC is closely supporting CDC’s Emergency Operations Center in combating the growing Zika outbreak.

title: From Value-Based Care to AI, Imaging Leaders Look to Radiology's Future
description: Medical imaging leaders are facing a number of challenges in the ongoing transformation of care delivery, yet many of the key market forces that are changing the field also are pushing imaging toward innovation, according to many imaging informatics leaders at a recent conference in New York City.
body: Medical imaging leaders are facing a number of challenges in the ongoing transformation of care delivery, yet many of the key market forces that are changing the field also are pushing imaging toward innovation, according to many imaging informatics leaders at a recent conference in New York City.

title: FDA’s medical device arm ramps up HIT strategies
description: Renewed emphasis will help agency with regulatory decision-making, says Bakul Patel.
body: Renewed emphasis will help agency with regulatory decision-making, says Bakul Patel.

title: Hospitals boost efforts to set rules for mobile devices
description: The number of facilities with documented plans has doubled in the past two years.
body: The number of facilities with documented plans has doubled in the past two years.
